title: If you dodge in ARAM you should end up with the same champ next game.
body:
You know what? It's called RANDOM for a reason. Tired of waiting 30 min queue because people dodge.

People leaving ARAM should be forced to get the same champ they got before their last leave.

replies.body: Yup. That and make ARAM random selection from pool of all champions. ARAM only accounts are ruining the randomness the same way people are dodging when they get champions they don't like.
This, or at least take into account the number and type of champions unlocked when matchmaking (since afaik most ARAM accounts only have a few champions unlocked).
This seems fair here.  Include champion pool size as a factor when matchmaking AR games.
Also disable Sona. Every time I play ARAM thinking it'll be a fun break from the Rift there's a Sona on the enemy team and I'm just like "ugh".
Only works vs Sona, not the rest of her teammates
It works on whoever you're trying to kill.
No. It actually doesn't. Look up Grievous Wounds. It only works on SELF-healing.

http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Grievous_Wounds

Wrong. It works on ALL healing as of patch 6.9. You're thinking of a period of time where it only worked on self-healing, but they reverted that change.
https://snag.gy/wzyHBa.jpg

V6.9
Now affects healing from all sources instead of self-healing.

They redid it to counter how op raka was.
Then they need to update their tags. in game it works on all healings

http://www.lolking.net/items/3123

Maybe if more people built Executioners, Sona wouldn't be as Freelo. Or hell, try actually focusing her; every time I've gotten Sona on ARAM, I play in mortal terror that eventually the enemy team's brain cells might rub together, produce a few sparks, and they'll actually focus me. Much of her team-boosting power requires her to be in the fight with her allies, so drop some CC on her and dogpile. She folds easily. Between people not focusing her and clumping up for her stun to hit everyone at once, of course she's running rampant. Might as well stack health vs a Kog'maw with BoRK and complain that he's killing you too fast.

> make ARAM random selection from pool of all champions.

This probably is a solution to ARAM only accounts but it also hurts a lot of other accounts that aren't ARAM oriented but just have a small champion pool. This way, earning chests or keys in ARAM would be next to impossible if the majority of champions you don't have, you get to play regularly.

So, solving a problem that is only tied to a small number of accounts and thus hurting a big portion of regular accounts isn't a good trade-off.

If you've played at high level ARAM, it's not a small number of accounts that are ARAM only. Every game becomes long range pokes, the most OP tanks, and the best supports/cc/healers.

 It would hurt brand new players somewhat because they'd get a lot of champions they've never even heard of, but if matchmaking is working they'll be against other new people too, so this really shouldn't be hurting much of anyone except ARAM accounts if matchmaking is working correctly.

I'm not sure what high level ARAM means.
I did play quite a lot of ARAM this season and i've also had games where my team doesn't get anything while the enemy team gets pokes that we simply lose to because we can't respond. But let's be clear about one thing:

I'm not denying that they exist because Riot even confirmed it.
But i can't identify ARAM accounts myself and it can always appear when my team gets severely outpicked by random, that this is probably because of those pesky ARAM accounts. That doesn't mean my assumption is true. I guess that identifying an ARAM account is done by looking up their op.gg history, champion selection and if they ever played anything else but ARAM. But from a single game, i can't know for sure.

My argument wasn't about people having to play champions they don't know how to. That's how ARAM works. It was about not getting loot when you get something that you don't own.
I have 31 champions in my pool and my accout isn't an ARAM account. These are simply champions i am comfortable with on SR and if the entire pool would suddenly become available (136 champions), getting eligible for loot would be roughly 25% x % win rate x % chance for key fragment drops (really low). Getting an S would equally be tedious.

Well by high level I think he means, as soon as you stop seeing bots (for the most part) in your games, you're getting close to 'high level' and when I got my account a really good win rate in ARAM with tons of games played, I started seeing only ARAM accounts nonstop for every game, literally every game that's how I identify it as 'high level' but it's just a term I made up to describe the matching. This is a much bigger concern than getting free rerolls/rewards. They would obviously have to alter rewards if they opened the entire champ pool for randomness.

Of course there's a chance you'll get a really good player who just happens to have a lot of champions unlocked and are at the same 'winrate' as the ARAM only accounts, and that person is at a severe disadvantage even if they are more skilled, not only for themselves but for whoever gets them on their team, and I'm not blaming them, I'm blaming the ARAM only accounts.

Honestly, they should simply increase the ARAM dodge timer massively to counter the additional incentive people have, compared to other game modes, to dodge. Same applies to the rotating game modes that are not all pick.

Alright, so, I get Draven. Can't play Draven for shit and I know I'll feed. No one wants him and I have no rerolls.

But I can't dodge without being forced Draven, over and over, until I do play him.

I play him. I feed my ass off and do next to no damage because I can't juggle his axes for the life of me.

I get flamed and raged at for it, possibly even reported for intent feeding.

No thank you, I'll just stop playing arams since I like to play champions I know I can at least do decent with, not champions that I wont have fun playing and that I'll ruin a fun game with because I can't play them.

Out of curiosity what would happen if someone were to dodge on X champ, then someone else were to dodge on the same champ, then those two people party together?  

In fact you could specifically dodge on OP champs and actually build up teams in advance for ARAM tournaments couldn't you?  Unfortunately removing the randomness is unhealthy for the queue however you go about it.  I think the better solution is just a slower decay on ARAM penalties so that if you DC or something you don't get punished, but if you frequently dodge it gets far worse than currently and you have to play more games without dodging to be able to reduce your penalty.
*refunds Champion*

knowing me and my friends... we would abuse this by playing games until we would get specific champs.. and then all queue together with them. the only good fix i see to this is to cumulatively increase dodge timers for every dodge/afk.. and have it reset weekly. this way, dodges can still happen, but they become less frequent.

also, forcing somebody to play a shitty champ?? sure.... as long as they're on your team! :P

TBH playing a ton of ARAM games for one stomp game is an okay trade in my book. If you guys are smart about your picks, the game will be over quickly anyways, meaning that not much is lost.

But OP's idea would have to be paired with the idea that ARAM champs should be picked from all champions, not just the ones you own.
